derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English wermōd. The change in spelling in late Middle English was due to association with worm and wood. Compare with vermouth

entry.tran: 蒿，洋艾，苦艾(味苦，可入药及制酒)
entry.def: Wormwood is a plant that has a very bitter taste and is used in making medicines and alcoholic drinks.

means.word_mean: 1. any of several low composite herbs of the genera Artemisia or Seriphidium
